However, Alcaraz quickly regained control in the third set, ultimately securing the victory despite Sinner saving two championship points.The victory improved Alcaraz's head-to-head record against Sinner to 10 wins in 15 meetings, including a 4-2 advantage in Grand Slam encounters, with two of these victories coming at the US Open.Both Alcaraz and women's champion Aryna Sabalenka, who defeated Amanda Anisimova in the women's final, received equal prize money of $5 million, representing a 39 percent increase from the previous year's payout.
